    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs the program and catches any inital user-side errors, such as not entering a commend line argument.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments the user should enter. Only one command line argument is needed: the name of the text file to manipulate.

      • promptForMove

        public static boolean promptForMove()
        Prompts the user for whether or not they want to move the edited file to a different directory.
        Returns:
        true if the user wants to move the file to a different directory; false otherwise.

      • isUpper

        public static boolean isUpper()
        Prompts the user for if they want to make the text file's characters lower- or uppercase.
        Returns:
        true if the user wants the characters to be uppercase; false if they want it lowercase.

      • getPath

        public static java.nio.file.Path getPath(java.lang.String message)
        Prompts the user to enter a path to a directory, which can be where the file is located or where it should be moved.
        Parameters:
        message - a message prompting the user either to enter the path to the directory where teh file is located or where the file should be moved.
        Returns:
        a Path to where the file is located or should be moved.

      • isValidPath

        public static boolean isValidPath(java.lang.String path)
        Parameters:
        path - the path in question as a String
        Returns:
        whether or not the path is valid

      • readFile

        public static void readFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lines)
        Reads in the contents of the file and add each line to an ArrayList, where each line is a separate element
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file
        lines - the ArrayList each line in the file will be stored in

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lines,
                               CaseFunction func)
        Updates the file being used, making every letter either lowercase or uppercase.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file
        lines - the ArrayList containing each line as an element
        func - the lambda expression that either makes each letter lower- or uppercase
